answers.answer: If a cleft lip was visible..im sure u would have been told...worrying wont help.. so enjoy...

My 2nd child was born with cleft lip and palette. It was noticeable in my 20 week ultra sound. In the ultra sound it did not look off center. It was a big dark gaping hole. Also I never had any excess fluid, never heard of that being associated with cl/p.  They specifically look for cl/p in ultra sounds.  If they hadn't said anything I really wouldn't worry. If you are still concerned just talk to you doctor about it. Maybe he can pull up your ultra sound and show you where it would be and explain how a cl/p would look be not
Thank you for your response, I will speak to the doctor but hopefully I'm just over reacting.
No problem if you have any more questions relating to cl/p feel free to ask me.
They would notice it for sure I was worried about that at my 20 week appointment and my doctor said that is one of the things they check for. You could also ask at your next appointment
In your anatomy scan, they specifically look for cleft lip. If she had one, they would have said so back then. It is very common to see their lips or nose squished in a 3D  scan.
Thanks so much guys, I also Googled cleft lip 3d ultrasound and her lip doesn't look anything like the results I got so I will relax and just to be sure I will mention it at my next appointment!  :)
If your ultrasound was just for fun the person performing the ultrasound is not allowed to tell you anything other that " that's your baby!" If you have concers you need to address them with your OB.

question: I just had a 3d/4d ultrasound for fun and in some of the pictures my babys lip looked a little dark and kinda off center from her nose, the tech said she was pressed against my uterine wall and that is why she looked smooshed but of course I am a little worried about cleft lip. Would my doctor have noticed if it were cleft lip in my anatomy ultrasound or does that not detect them. Im 29 weeks and have had several ultrasounds bc of my age and he has never mentioned it. I also have excess fluid and I have gestational diabetes which can cause excess fluid but so can cleft lip. Anyone have any info that may be useful?
title: Babys lip
